properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 12:06PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids has issued a flood
warning for the following rivers in Southwest Lower Michigan...

Grand River At Eaton Rapids affecting Eaton County
Grand River at Ionia affecting Ionia County
Grand River at Lowell affecting Kent County
Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County
Grand River at Robinson Township affecting Ottawa County
Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County
Thornapple River Above Hastings affecting Barry County

...Forecast Flooding Changed from Minor to Moderate Severity for the
following rivers in Southwest Lower Michigan...
Sycamore Creek At Holt affecting Ingham County

.2 to 2.5 inches of rain has fallen overnight across much of the area
between Lansing and Jackson. This water will be finding its way into
the rivers over the next few days and will be leading to significant
increases in water level. Minor flooding is now expected on the Grand
River all the way down to Lowell, as well as some of the more
flood-prone areas around Comstock Park and Robinson Township.
Additional precipitation today will be falling as freezing rain,
sleet, or snow, and will limit how much additional water is able
to start flowing into the rivers. The following forecast is based on
observed and forecast 48 hour precipitation.

The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Grand River at Robinson Township.
* from late Monday night until further notice.
* At  9:00 AM Saturday the stage was 12.8 feet.
* Flood stage is 13.3 feet.
* Minor Flooding is forecast.
* Forecast, rise above flood stage by early Tuesday morning and
continue to rise to near 14.9 feet by Thursday early afternoon.
* Impact, at 15.0 feet...Vanlopik Road is 1 to 2 feet under water.
Moderate flooding of several homes on the east end of Vanlopik
subdivision occurs.
* Flood history, this crest compares to a previous crest of 14.9 feet
on Dec 28 2008.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock
you off your feet... and a depth of 2 feet will float your car.
Never try to walk... swim... or drive through such swift water.  If
you come upon flood waters... stop... turn around and go another way.

This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood
stage.

Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local
radio... television... or NOAA Weather Radio station for further
information.

Additional weather and river information can be found on our homepage
at www.weather.gov/grr
